awd_titl_txt: Instability Mechanisms in Adaptive Control of Robots and    Teleoperators
awd_abstract_narration: This project addresses the topic of adaptive control of robots.                 Specifically, if focuses on instability mechanisms in the                       adaptive control of robots and teleoperators.  These instability                phenomena arises from external disturbances and unmodeled                       dynamics.  The phenomena to be investigated include slow                        parameter drift instabilities, high gain instabilities, fast                    adaptation instabilities, bursting, and others.  Various                        techniques including singular perturbation theory and averaging,                integral manifolds, network theory and scattering theory will be                used to understand the basic phenomena.  Experiments will be                    conducted on robotic devices to test theory.  Ultimately, it is                 expected that understanding these instability phenomena will be a               factor in the design and implementation of robust controllers for               robots.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
